page.title: 05CHESTERTON'S CHAPEL
page.content: St.Lawrence's Hall,built in 1951,is now in the centre of Chesterton's housing estates.The main room takes up most of the 1350m2 floor area.There is no vicar resident so clergy from St.John's Church,Cirencester officiate at the monthly Family Services.A young people's group called JamPack (Jesus & Me) meet on the other Sundays.The Hall has many other more secular uses in its role as a Community Centre.These are as follows: Each morning,Monday-Friday,Playgroup for under 5s Monday afternoons-Family Time-Mothers Meeting Monday evenings-Judo Club,martial arts Tuesday evenings-Popmobility-Ladies keep fit classes to popular music Wednesday evenings-Youth Club Thursday evenings-Aikido-martial arts Friday evenings-Brownies Meeting.
